intro: Chorispora syriaca, commonly known as Syrian winter cress, is an annual flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, and it produces small, round pods containing several seeds. Chorispora syriaca is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
